field.label: Prune archived cards
field.comment: All cards (including for guests and 'do not save') are always stored internally. If yes, those records will be permanently removed after they've been inactive for a certain period of time. We strongly recommend this.

field.label: Prune archived cards after
field.comment: Amount of time to remove archived cards after. Default is 120 days, the maximum linked refund period.

field.label: Save new order immediately after payment
field.comment: By default, Magento does not save an order during checkout until after all processing has completed successfully. However, this allows poorly coded integrations to prevent the order going through, even after payment has been processed. Enabling this setting will save the order immediately after payment processes successfully, ensuring you have the order even if post-processing fails. NOTE: Allowing orders to go through without successful post-processing can have major and negative ramifications on integrations. Do not enable this unless you are confident it's worth the risk. Use at your own risk; support will not cover problems caused by use of this setting.

field.label: Enable public API
field.comment: If 'Yes', Magento's REST and GraphQL APIs will allow customer card management. Only enable this if you use them.

field.label: Require an order to access My Payment Options
field.comment: If 'Yes', customers will only be able to add/edit payment options on their account after placing an order. We strongly recommend this.

field.label: Max checkout errors per session
field.comment: Block a customer from checkout after they fail to submit an order this many times within the time below. This is to help block card testing attacks. Default is 5.

field.label: Max checkout errors timeframe (sec)
field.comment: The amount of time to record and block for checkout errors (for the setting above), in seconds. Default is 86400, one day.
